meanings.definition: Wishing to do what is right and to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly.
meanings.sent1: She is a conscientious student who always completes her assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: The conscientious employee double-checked all the details before submitting the report.
meanings.sent3: The conscientious squirrel meticulously organized its acorn collection.
meanings.sent4: His conscientious approach to gardening ensured a flourishing and vibrant garden.
meanings.sent5: Being conscientious about recycling helps protect the environment.

meanings.definition: Governed by or done according to conscience; scrupulous.
meanings.sent1: The conscientious decision to speak up against injustice was commendable.
meanings.sent2: She always followed her conscientious beliefs, even when it was difficult.
meanings.sent3: The conscientious cat refused to eat the fish because it felt guilty about catching it.
meanings.sent4: His conscientious nature shone brightly in the face of moral dilemmas.
meanings.sent5: The conscientious artist poured their heart and soul into every brushstroke.
